value.halfverse: and all the hardships he endured;
and vowed a vow to the Mighty One of Jacob:
value.verse: How he swore an oath to the LORD *

value.halfverse: nor climb up into my bed;
value.verse: “I will not come under the roof of my house, *
I will not allow my eyes to sleep, *

value.halfverse: a dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
value.verse: Until I find a place for the LORD, *
“The ark! We heard it was in Ephratah; *
value.halfverse: we found it in the fields of Jearim.
let us fall upon our knees before his footstool.”
value.verse: Let us go to God’s dwelling place; *

value.halfverse: you and the ark of your strength.
value.verse: Arise, O LORD, into your resting-place, *
Let your priests be clothed with righteousness; *
value.halfverse: let your faithful people sing with joy.
do not turn away the face of your Anointed.

value.verse: The LORD has sworn an oath to David; *
value.halfverse: in truth, he will not break it:

value.verse: “A son, the fruit of your body *
value.halfverse: will I set upon your throne.
their children will sit upon your throne for evermore.”
value.verse:
If your children keep my covenant
and my testimonies that I shall teach them, *
For the LORD has chosen Zion; *
value.halfverse: he has desired her for his habitation:

value.verse: “This shall be my resting-place for ever; *
value.halfverse: here will I dwell, for I delight in her.
and satisfy her poor with bread.
value.verse: I will surely bless her provisions, *

value.halfverse: and her faithful people will rejoice and sing.
value.verse: I will clothe her priests with salvation, *

value.halfverse: I have prepared a lamp for my Anointed.
value.verse: There will I make the horn of David flourish; *

value.halfverse: but as for him, his crown will shine.”
value.verse: As for his enemies, I will clothe them with shame; *
